result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicolas Weaver Montminy

records.addlTxt: 11:07 AM . Defendant Nicolas Weaver Montminy in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill  in court for Nicolas Weaver Montminy.  Prosecuting attorney Cecilia DeMarco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court will consider reopening if DPU screens and finds that he doesn't qualify for their program.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.

9:38 AM Defendant Nicolas Weaver Montminy in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill for Glenn Edward Avena in court for Nicolas Weaver Montminy.  Prosecuting attorney Rebekah M Rennicke in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List- State of Wisconsin
Status conference on August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

03:27 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Glenn Edward Avena.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Charles K. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:34 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Eric James Caudill.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Warrant vacated.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
